what: Manipulation of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents
title: Manipulation of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents
text: Make corporate reporting minimum hassle  officer package lets R users manipulate Word (.docx) PowerPoint (*.pptx) documents. short, one can add images, tables text documents R. initial document can provided; contents, styles properties original document available. also supports writing ‘RTF’ documents.

title: Manipulation of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents
text: help pages bookdown located : https://ardata-fr.github.io/officeverse/ Manuals available : https://davidgohel.github.io/officer/.

title: Manipulation of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents
text: read_docx() function read initial Word document (empty one default) lets modify content later. package provides functions add R outputs Word document: images: produce plot png emf files add document, whole paragraph inside paragraph. tables: add data.frames tables, format defined associated Word table style. text: add text paragraphs inside existing paragraph, format defined associated Word paragraph text styles. field codes: add Word field codes inside paragraphs. Field codes old feature MS Word create calculated elements tables contents, automatic numbering hyperlinks. File generation performed print function.

title: Manipulation of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents
text: function read_pptx() read initial PowerPoint document (empty one default) let modify content later. package provides functions add R outputs existing new PowerPoint slides: images: produce plot png emf files add slide. tables: add data.frames tables, format defined associated PowerPoint table style. text: add text paragraphs inside existing paragraph, format defined corresponding layout slide. PowerPoint document, one can set slide selected reach particular shape (remove add text). File generation performed print() function.

title: Add a slide — add_slide
text: x rpptx object. layout slide layout name use. Can ommited default layout set via layout_default(). master master layout name layout located. required case several masters layout unique. ... Key-value pairs form "short form location" = object passed phs_with. See section "Short forms" phs_with details, available short forms examples. .dots List key-value pairs form list("short form location" = object). Alternative .... See phs_with details.

title: Add a slide — add_slide
code: x <- read_pptx()  layout_summary(x) # available layouts #>              layout       master #> 1       Title Slide Office Theme #> 2 Title and Content Office Theme #> 3    Section Header Office Theme #> 4       Two Content Office Theme #> 5        Comparison Office Theme #> 6        Title Only Office Theme #> 7             Blank Office Theme  x <- add_slide(x, layout = "Two Content")  x <- layout_default(x, "Title Slide") # set default layout for `add_slide()` x <- add_slide(x) # uses default layout  # use `...` to fill placeholders when adding slide x <- add_slide(x,   layout = "Two Content", `Title 1` = "A title",   dt = "Jan. 26, 2025", `body[2]` = "Body 2",   left = "Left side", `6` = "Footer" )

",   bkm = "mtcars_table") caption <- block_caption("mtcars table",   style = "Normal",   autonum = run_num )  doc_1 <- read_docx() doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, "A title", style = "heading 1") doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, "Hello world!", style = "Normal") doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, caption) doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, mtcars, style = "table_template")  print(doc_1, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

title: 'ggplot' block — block_gg
text: value 'ggplot' object fp_p paragraph formatting properties, see fp_par() width, height image size units expressed unit argument. Defaults ""ches. res resolution png image ppi scale Multiplicative scaling factor, ggsave unit One following units width height arguments expressed: "", "cm" "mm".

title: 'ggplot' block — block_gg
code: library(officer) if (require("ggplot2")) {   set.seed(2)   doc <- read_docx()    z <- body_append_start_context(doc)    for (i in seq_len(3)) {     df <- data.frame(x = runif(10), y = runif(10))     gg <- ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point()      write_elements_to_context(       context = z,       block_gg(         value = gg       )     )   }    doc <- body_append_stop_context(z)    print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx")) } #> Loading required package: ggplot2

title: Add content into a Word document — body_add
text: body_add(character): add character vector. body_add(numeric): add numeric vector. body_add(factor): add factor vector. body_add(fpar): add fpar object. objects enable creation formatted paragraphs made formatted chunks text. body_add(data.frame): add data.frame object block_table(). body_add(block_caption): add block_caption object. objects enable creation set formatted paragraphs made formatted chunks text. body_add(block_list): add block_list object. Use function add list block elements (e.g. paragraphs, images, tables) Word document efficient way usual body_add_* functions. function add several elements faster way cursor calculated iteraction elements, consequence function append elements end document allow insert elements specific position. body_add(block_toc): add table content (block_toc object). body_add(external_img): add image (external_img object). body_add(run_pagebreak): add run_pagebreak object. body_add(run_columnbreak): add run_columnbreak object. body_add(gg): add ggplot object. body_add(plot_instr): add base plot plot_instr object. body_add(block_pour_docx): pour content external docx file block_pour_docx object body_add(block_section): ends section block_section object

title: Add content into a Word document — body_add
code: doc_1 <- read_docx() doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, "Table of content", style = "heading 1") doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, block_toc()) doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, run_pagebreak()) doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, "A title", style = "heading 1") doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, head(iris), style = "table_template") doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, "Another title", style = "heading 1") doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, letters, style = "Normal") doc_1 <- body_add(   doc_1,   block_section(prop_section(type = "continuous")) ) doc_1 <- body_add(doc_1, plot_instr(code = barplot(1:5, col = 2:6))) doc_1 <- body_add(   doc_1,   block_section(prop_section(page_size = page_size(orient = "landscape"))) ) print(doc_1, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx")) # print(doc_1, target = "test.docx")

what: Fast Append context to a Word document — body_append_start_context
title: Fast Append context to a Word document — body_append_start_context
text: function used append content Word document fast way. use XML tree document neither cursor responsible increasing performance Word document generation looping large number elements. function must used write_elements_to_context() body_append_stop_context() functions: body_append_start_context() creates context returns list context file connection. write_elements_to_context() writes elements context file connection. body_append_stop_context() closes file connection replaces XML document new XML.

title: Fast Append context to a Word document — body_append_start_context
code: body_append_start_context(x)  write_elements_to_context(context, ...)  body_append_stop_context(context)

title: Fast Append context to a Word document — body_append_start_context
text: x rdocx object context context object created body_append_start_context(). ... elements written context. can paragraphs, tables, images, etc. elements associated to_wml() method converts WML format.

title: Fast Append context to a Word document — body_append_start_context
text: body_append_start_context() returns list representing context contains: doc: original document object file_con: file connection context file_path: path context file final_str: final XML string appended document later calling body_append_stop_context(). object modified user instead passed write_elements_to_context() body_append_stop_context(). write_elements_to_context() returns context object. body_append_stop_context() returns rdocx object cursor position set end document.

title: Fast Append context to a Word document — body_append_start_context
code: library(officer)  doc <- read_docx() doc <- body_add_par(doc, value = "blah blah blah", style = "Normal")  z <- body_append_start_context(doc)  for (i in seq_len(50)) {   write_elements_to_context(     context = z,     fpar(       "Hello World, ", i,       fp_p = fp_par(word_style = "heading 1")),     fpar(run_pagebreak())   ) } doc <- body_append_stop_context(z)   print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

code: library(officer)  str1 <- rep("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. ", 20) str3 <- paste(str3, collapse = "")  my_doc <- read_docx() my_doc <- body_add_par(my_doc, value = str1, style = "Normal") my_doc <- body_add_par(my_doc, value = str2, style = "centered") my_doc <- body_add_par(my_doc, value = str3, style = "Normal")  new_doc_file <- print(my_doc,   target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx") )  my_doc <- read_docx(path = new_doc_file) my_doc <- cursor_reach(my_doc, keyword = "that text") my_doc <- body_remove(my_doc)  print(my_doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

what: Replace text anywhere in the document — body_replace_all_text
title: Replace text anywhere in the document — body_replace_all_text
text: Replace text anywhere document, cursor. Replace occurrences old_value new_value. method uses grepl()/gsub() pattern matching; may supply arguments required (therefore use regex() features) using optional ... argument. Note default, grepl/gsub use fixed=FALSE, means old_value new_value interepreted regular expressions. Chunking text Note behind--scenes representation text Word document frequently might expect! Sometimes paragraph text broken ("chunked") several "runs," result style changes, pauses text entry, later revisions edits, etc. styled text, entered "--" fashion, e.g. pasting outputing programmatically Word document, likely problem. working manually-edited document, however, can lead unexpected failures find text. can use officer function docx_show_chunk() show paragraph text current cursor chunked runs, text chunk. can help troubleshoot unexpected failures find text.

title: Replace text anywhere in the document — body_replace_all_text
code: doc <- read_docx() doc <- body_add_par(doc, "Placeholder one") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "Placeholder two")  # Show text chunk at cursor docx_show_chunk(doc)  # Output is 'Placeholder two' #> 1 text nodes found at this cursor.  #>   <w:t>: 'Placeholder two'  # Simple search-and-replace at current cursor, with regex turned off doc <- body_replace_all_text(doc, old_value = "Placeholder",   new_value = "new", only_at_cursor = TRUE, fixed = TRUE) docx_show_chunk(doc)  # Output is 'new two' #> 1 text nodes found at this cursor.  #>   <w:t>: 'new two'  # Do the same, but in the entire document and ignoring case doc <- body_replace_all_text(doc, old_value = "placeholder",   new_value = "new", only_at_cursor=FALSE, ignore.case = TRUE) doc <- cursor_backward(doc) docx_show_chunk(doc) # Output is 'new one' #> 1 text nodes found at this cursor.  #>   <w:t>: 'new one'  # Use regex : replace all words starting with "n" with the word "example" doc <- body_replace_all_text(doc, "\\bn.*?\\b", "example") docx_show_chunk(doc) # Output is 'example one' #> 1 text nodes found at this cursor.  #>   <w:t>: 'example one'

code: library(officer)  # create a template ---- doc <- read_docx() doc <- body_add_par(doc, "blah blah blah") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "blah blah blah") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "blah blah blah") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "Hello text to replace") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "blah blah blah") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "blah blah blah") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "blah blah blah") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "Hello text to replace") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "blah blah blah") template_file <- print(   x = doc,   target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx") )  # replace all pars containing "to replace" ---- doc <- read_docx(path = template_file) while (cursor_reach_test(doc, "to replace")) {   doc <- cursor_reach(doc, "to replace")    doc <- body_add_fpar(     x = doc,     pos = "on",     value = fpar(       "Here is a link: ",       hyperlink_ftext(         text = "yopyop",         href = "https://cran.r-project.org/"       )     )   ) }  doc <- cursor_end(doc) doc <- body_add_par(doc, "Yap yap yap yap...")  result_file <- print(   x = doc,   target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx") )  # cursor_bookmark ----  doc <- read_docx() doc <- body_add_par(doc, "centered text", style = "centered") doc <- body_bookmark(doc, "text_to_replace") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "A title", style = "heading 1") doc <- body_add_par(doc, "Hello world!", style = "Normal") doc <- cursor_bookmark(doc, "text_to_replace") doc <- body_add_table(doc, value = iris, style = "table_template")  print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

title: Empty block for 'PowerPoint' — empty_content
text: Create empty object include empty placeholder shape presentation. comes handy presentation updated R, user still wants add comments new content. Empty content also works layout fields (slide number date) preserve : included slide keep updated PowerPoint, .e. update slide number slide moves deck, update date.

title: Empty block for 'PowerPoint' — empty_content
code: empty_content()

title: Empty block for 'PowerPoint' — empty_content
code: fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, layout = "Two Content",   master = "Office Theme") doc <- ph_with(x = doc, value = empty_content(),  location = ph_location_type(type = "title") )  doc <- add_slide(doc, "Title and Content") # add slide number as a computer field doc <- ph_with(   x = doc, value = empty_content(),   location = ph_location_type(type = "sldNum"))  print(doc, target = fileout )

title: External image — external_img
text: Wraps image object can embedded PowerPoint slide within Word paragraph. image added shape PowerPoint (possible mix text images PowerPoint form). Word document, image added inside paragraph.

title: External image — external_img
code: external_img(   src,   width = 0.5,   height = 0.2,   unit = "in",   guess_size = FALSE,   alt = "" )

title: External image — external_img
text: src image file path width, height size image file. can ignored parameter guess_size=TRUE, see parameter guess_size. unit unit width height, one "", "cm", "mm". guess_size package 'magick' installed, option can used (set TRUE). images read width height guessed. alt alternative text images

title: External image — external_img
text: can use function conjunction fpar create paragraphs consisting differently formatted text parts. can also use function r chunk R Markdown document made package officedown.

title: External image — external_img
code: # wrap r logo with external_img ---- srcfile <- file.path(R.home("doc"), "html", "logo.jpg") extimg <- external_img(   src = srcfile, height = 1.06 / 2,   width = 1.39 / 2 )  # pptx example ---- doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, "Title and Content") doc <- ph_with(   x = doc, value = extimg,   location = ph_location_type(type = "body"),   use_loc_size = FALSE ) print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".pptx"))  fp_t <- fp_text(font.size = 20, color = "red") an_fpar <- fpar(extimg, ftext(" is cool!", fp_t))  # docx example ---- x <- read_docx() x <- body_add(x, an_fpar) print(x, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

title: Border properties object — fp_border
text: color border color - single character value (e.g. "#000000" "black") style border style - single character value : See Details supported border styles. width border width - integer value : 0>= value object fp_border object ... arguments - used

title: Border properties object — fp_border
text: Word output following border styles supported: "none" "nil" - Border "solid" "single" - Single Line Border "thick" - Single Line Border "double" - Double Line Border "dotted" - Dotted Line Border "dashed" - Dashed Line Border "dotDash" - Dot Dash Line Border "dotDotDash" - Dot Dot Dash Line Border "triple" - Triple Line Border "thinThickSmallGap" - Thin, Thick Line Border "thickThinSmallGap" - Thick, Thin Line Border "thinThickThinSmallGap" - Thin, Thick, Thin Line Border "thinThickMediumGap" - Thin, Thick Line Border "thickThinMediumGap" - Thick, Thin Line Border "thinThickThinMediumGap" - Thin, Thick, Thin Line Border "thinThickLargeGap" - Thin, Thick Line Border "thickThinLargeGap" - Thick, Thin Line Border "thinThickThinLargeGap" - Thin, Thick, Thin Line Border "wave" - Wavy Line Border "doubleWave" - Double Wave Line Border "dashSmallGap" - Dashed Line Border "dashDotStroked" - Dash Dot Strokes Line Border "threeDEmboss" "ridge" - 3D Embossed Line Border "threeDEngrave" "groove" - 3D Engraved Line Border "outset" - Outset Line Border "inset" - Inset Line Border HTML output limited amount border styles supported: "none" "nil" - Border "solid" "single" - Single Line Border "double" - Double Line Border "dotted" - Dotted Line Border "dashed" - Dashed Line Border "threeDEmboss" "ridge" - 3D Embossed Line Border "threeDEngrave" "groove" - 3D Engraved Line Border "outset" - Outset Line Border "inset" - Inset Line Border Non-supported Word border styles default "solid".

title: Border properties object — fp_border
code: fp_border() #> line: color: black, width: 1, style: solid fp_border(color = "orange", style = "solid", width = 1) #> line: color: orange, width: 1, style: solid fp_border(color = "gray", style = "dotted", width = 1) #> line: color: gray, width: 1, style: dotted  # modify object ------ border <- fp_border() update(border, style = "dotted", width = 3) #> line: color: black, width: 3, style: dotted

code: fp_cell(   border = fp_border(width = 0),   border.bottom,   border.left,   border.top,   border.right,   vertical.align = "center",   margin = 0,   margin.bottom,   margin.top,   margin.left,   margin.right,   background.color = "transparent",   text.direction = "lrtb",   rowspan = 1,   colspan = 1 )  # S3 method for class 'fp_cell' format(x, type = "wml", ...)  # S3 method for class 'fp_cell' print(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'fp_cell' update(   object,   border,   border.bottom,   border.left,   border.top,   border.right,   vertical.align,   margin = 0,   margin.bottom,   margin.top,   margin.left,   margin.right,   background.color,   text.direction,   rowspan = 1,   colspan = 1,   ... )

title: Cell formatting properties — fp_cell
text: border shortcut borders. border.bottom, border.left, border.top, border.right fp_border() borders. vertical.align cell content vertical alignment - single character value, expected value one "center" "top" "bottom" margin shortcut margins. margin.bottom, margin.top, margin.left, margin.right cell margins - 0 positive integer value. background.color cell background color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). text.direction cell text rotation - single character value, expected value one "lrtb", "tbrl", "btlr". rowspan specify many rows cell spanned colspan specify many columns cell spanned x, object fp_cell object type output type - one 'wml', 'pml', 'html', 'rtf'. ... arguments - used

title: Paragraph formatting properties — fp_par

title: Paragraph formatting properties — fp_par
code: fp_par(   text.align = "left",   padding = 0,   line_spacing = 1,   border = fp_border(width = 0),   padding.bottom,   padding.top,   padding.left,   padding.right,   border.bottom,   border.left,   border.top,   border.right,   shading.color = "transparent",   keep_with_next = FALSE,   tabs = NULL,   word_style = "Normal" )  fp_par_lite(   text.align = NA,   padding = NA,   line_spacing = NA,   border = FALSE,   padding.bottom = NA,   padding.top = NA,   padding.left = NA,   padding.right = NA,   border.bottom = FALSE,   border.left = FALSE,   border.top = FALSE,   border.right = FALSE,   shading.color = NA,   keep_with_next = NA,   tabs = FALSE,   word_style = NA )  # S3 method for class 'fp_par' print(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'fp_par' update(   object,   text.align,   padding,   border,   padding.bottom,   padding.top,   padding.left,   padding.right,   border.bottom,   border.left,   border.top,   border.right,   shading.color,   keep_with_next,   word_style,   ... )

title: Paragraph formatting properties — fp_par
text: text.align text alignment - single character value, expected value one 'left', 'right', 'center', 'justify'. padding paragraph paddings - 0 positive integer value. Argument padding overwrites arguments padding.bottom, padding.top, padding.left, padding.right. line_spacing line spacing, 1 single line spacing, 2 double line spacing. border shortcut borders. padding.bottom, padding.top, padding.left, padding.right paragraph paddings - 0 positive integer value. border.bottom, border.left, border.top, border.right fp_border() borders. overwrite border properties. shading.color shading color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). keep_with_next scalar logical. Specifies paragraph (least part ) rendered page next paragraph possible. tabs NULL (default) tabulation marks setting object returned fp_tabs(). Note can effect Word RTF outputs. word_style Word paragraph style name x, object fp_par object ... arguments - used

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text
code: fp_text(   color = "black",   font.size = 10,   bold = FALSE,   italic = FALSE,   underlined = FALSE,   font.family = "Arial",   cs.family = NULL,   eastasia.family = NULL,   hansi.family = NULL,   vertical.align = "baseline",   shading.color = "transparent" )  fp_text_lite(   color = NA,   font.size = NA,   font.family = NA,   cs.family = NA,   eastasia.family = NA,   hansi.family = NA,   bold = NA,   italic = NA,   underlined = NA,   vertical.align = "baseline",   shading.color = NA )  # S3 method for class 'fp_text' format(x, type = "wml", ...)  # S3 method for class 'fp_text' print(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'fp_text' update(   object,   color,   font.size,   bold,   italic,   underlined,   font.family,   cs.family,   eastasia.family,   hansi.family,   vertical.align,   shading.color,   ... )

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text
text: color font color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). font.size font size (point) - 0 positive integer value. bold bold italic italic underlined underlined font.family single character value. Specifies font used format characters Unicode range (U+0000-U+007F). cs.family optional font used format characters complex script Unicode range. example, Arabic text might displayed using "Arial Unicode MS" font. eastasia.family optional font used format characters East Asian Unicode range. example, Japanese text might displayed using "MS Mincho" font. hansi.family optional. Specifies font used format characters Unicode range fall one categories. vertical.align single character value specifying font vertical alignments. Expected value one following : default 'baseline' 'subscript' 'superscript' shading.color shading color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). x fp_text object type output type - one 'wml', 'pml', 'html', 'rtf'. ... arguments - used object fp_text object modify format format type, wml MS word, pml MS PowerPoint html.

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text
text: fp_text object

title: Text formatting properties — fp_text
code: fp_text() #>   font.size italic  bold underlined color     shading fontname fontname_cs #> 1        10  FALSE FALSE      FALSE black transparent    Arial       Arial #>   fontname_eastasia fontname.hansi vertical_align #> 1             Arial          Arial       baseline fp_text(color = "red") #>   font.size italic  bold underlined color     shading fontname fontname_cs #> 1        10  FALSE FALSE      FALSE   red transparent    Arial       Arial #>   fontname_eastasia fontname.hansi vertical_align #> 1             Arial          Arial       baseline fp_text(bold = TRUE, shading.color = "yellow") #>   font.size italic bold underlined color shading fontname fontname_cs #> 1        10  FALSE TRUE      FALSE black  yellow    Arial       Arial #>   fontname_eastasia fontname.hansi vertical_align #> 1             Arial          Arial       baseline print(fp_text(color = "red", font.size = 12)) #>   font.size italic  bold underlined color     shading fontname fontname_cs #> 1        12  FALSE FALSE      FALSE   red transparent    Arial       Arial #>   fontname_eastasia fontname.hansi vertical_align #> 1             Arial          Arial       baseline

title: Formatted paragraph — fpar
text: Create paragraph representation concatenating formatted text images. result can inserted Word document PowerPoint presentation can also inserted block_list() call. arguments concatenated create paragraph chunks text images associated formatting properties. fpar() supports ftext(), external_img(), run_*() functions (.e. run_autonum(), run_word_field()) output Word, simple strings. Default text paragraph formatting properties can also modified function update().

title: Formatted paragraph — fpar
code: fpar(..., fp_p = fp_par(), fp_t = fp_text_lite(), values = NULL)  # S3 method for class 'fpar' update(object, fp_p = NULL, fp_t = NULL, ...)

title: Formatted paragraph — fpar
text: ... cot objects (ftext(), external_img()) fp_p paragraph formatting properties, see fp_par() fp_t default text formatting properties. used text formatting properties simple text provided argument, see fp_text(). values list cot objects. provided, argument ... ignored. object fpar object

title: Formatted chunk of text — ftext
text: Format chunk text text formatting properties (bold, color, ...). function allows create pieces text formatted way want.

title: Formatted chunk of text — ftext
code: ftext(text, prop = NULL)

title: Formatted chunk of text — ftext
text: text text value, single character value prop formatting text properties returned fp_text. also can NULL case, formatting defined (default applied).

title: Formatted chunk of text — ftext
text: can use function conjunction fpar create paragraphs consisting differently formatted text parts. can also use function r chunk R Markdown document made package officedown.

title: Formatted chunk of text — ftext
code: ftext("hello", fp_text()) #> text: hello #> format: #>   font.size italic  bold underlined color     shading fontname fontname_cs #> 1        10  FALSE FALSE      FALSE black transparent    Arial       Arial #>   fontname_eastasia fontname.hansi vertical_align #> 1             Arial          Arial       baseline  properties1 <- fp_text(color = "red") properties2 <- fp_text(bold = TRUE, shading.color = "yellow") ftext1 <- ftext("hello", properties1) ftext2 <- ftext("World", properties2) paragraph <- fpar(ftext1, " ", ftext2)  x <- read_docx() x <- body_add(x, paragraph) print(x, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

what: Detect and handle duplicate placeholder labels — layout_dedupe_ph_labels
title: Detect and handle duplicate placeholder labels — layout_dedupe_ph_labels
text: PowerPoint enforce unique placeholder labels layout. Selecting placeholder via label using ph_location_label throw error, label unique. layout_dedupe_ph_labels helps detect, rename, delete duplicate placholder labels.

title: Detect and handle duplicate placeholder labels — layout_dedupe_ph_labels
code: layout_dedupe_ph_labels(x, action = "detect", print_info = FALSE)

title: Detect and handle duplicate placeholder labels — layout_dedupe_ph_labels
text: x rpptx object. action Action perform duplicate placeholder labels. One : detect (default) = show info dupes , make changes rename = create unique labels. Labels renamed appending sequential number separated dot duplicate labels. example, c("title", "title") becomes c("title.1", "title.2"). delete = keep one placeholders duplicate label print_info Print action information (e.g. renamed placeholders) console? Default FALSE. Always TRUE action detect.

title: Detect and handle duplicate placeholder labels — layout_dedupe_ph_labels
text: rpptx object (modified placeholder labels).

title: Detect and handle duplicate placeholder labels — layout_dedupe_ph_labels
code: x <- read_pptx() layout_dedupe_ph_labels(x) #> No duplicate placeholder labels detected.  file <- system.file("doc_examples", "ph_dupes.pptx", package = "officer") x <- read_pptx(file) layout_dedupe_ph_labels(x) #> Placeholders with duplicate labels: #> * 'ph_label_new' = new placeholder label for action = 'rename' #> * 'delete_flag' = deleted placeholders for action = 'delete' #>   master_name layout_name  ph_label ph_label_new delete_flag #> 1     Master1     2-dupes Content 7  Content 7.1       FALSE #> 2     Master1     2-dupes Content 7  Content 7.2        TRUE layout_dedupe_ph_labels(x, "rename", print_info = TRUE) #> Renamed duplicate placeholder labels: #> * 'ph_label_new' = new placeholder label #>   master_name layout_name  ph_label ph_label_new #> 1     Master1     2-dupes Content 7  Content 7.1 #> 2     Master1     2-dupes Content 7  Content 7.2

code: # set and remove the default layout x <- read_pptx() layout_default(x) # no defaults #> pptx document with 0 slides #> Available layouts and their associated master(s): #>              layout       master #> 1       Title Slide Office Theme #> 2 Title and Content Office Theme #> 3    Section Header Office Theme #> 4       Two Content Office Theme #> 5        Comparison Office Theme #> 6        Title Only Office Theme #> 7             Blank Office Theme x <- layout_default(x, "Title and Content") # set default layout_default(x) #> pptx document with 0 slides #> Available layouts and their associated master(s): #>              layout       master #> 1       Title Slide Office Theme #> 2 Title and Content Office Theme #> 3    Section Header Office Theme #> 4       Two Content Office Theme #> 5        Comparison Office Theme #> 6        Title Only Office Theme #> 7             Blank Office Theme x <- add_slide(x) # new slide with default layout x <- layout_default(x, NULL) # remove default layout_default(x) # no defaults #> pptx document with 1 slide #> Available layouts and their associated master(s): #>              layout       master #> 1       Title Slide Office Theme #> 2 Title and Content Office Theme #> 3    Section Header Office Theme #> 4       Two Content Office Theme #> 5        Comparison Office Theme #> 6        Title Only Office Theme #> 7             Blank Office Theme  # use when repeatedly adding slides with same layout x <- read_pptx() x <- layout_default(x, "Title and Content") x <- add_slide(x, title = "1. Slide", body = "Some content") x <- add_slide(x, title = "2. Slide", body = "Some more content") x <- add_slide(x, title = "3. Slide", body = "Even more content")

title: Slide layout properties — layout_properties
text: x rpptx object layout slide layout name. NULL, returns layouts. master master layout name layout located. NULL, returns masters.

title: Slide layout properties — layout_properties
text: Returns data frame one row per placeholder following columns: master_name: Name master (.pptx file may one) name: Name layout type: Placeholder type type_idx: Running index phs type. Ordering ph position (top -> bottom, left -> right) id: unique placeholder id (assigned PowerPoint automatically, starts 2, potentially non-consecutive) ph_label: Placeholder label (can set user PowerPoint) ph: Placholder XML fragment (usually needed) offx,offy: placeholder's distance left top edge (inch) cx,cy: width height placeholder (inch) rotation: rotation degrees fld_id generally stored hexadecimal GUID value fld_type: unique identifier particular field

what: Change ph labels in a layout — layout_rename_ph_labels
title: Change ph labels in a layout — layout_rename_ph_labels
text: two versions function. first takes set key-value pairs rename ph labels. second uses right hand side (rhs) assignment specify new ph labels. See section Details. NB: can also rename ph labels directly PowerPoint. Open master template view (Alt + F10) go Home > Arrange > Selection Pane.

title: Change ph labels in a layout — layout_rename_ph_labels
code: layout_rename_ph_labels(x, layout, master = NULL, ..., .dots = NULL)  layout_rename_ph_labels(x, layout, master = NULL, id = NULL) <- value

title: Change ph labels in a layout — layout_rename_ph_labels
text: x rpptx object. layout Layout name index. Index row index layout_summary(). master Name master. required layout name unique across masters. ... Comma separated list key-value pairs rename phs. Either reference ph via label ("old label" = "new label") unique id ("id" = "new label"). .dots Provide named list vector key-value pairs rename phs (list("old label" = "new label"). id Unique placeholder id (see column id layout_properties() plot_layout_properties()). value relevant user. pure technical necessity rhs assignments.

title: Change ph labels in a layout — layout_rename_ph_labels
text: Vector renamed ph labels.

title: Change ph labels in a layout — layout_rename_ph_labels
text: Note difference terms id index. can found output layout_properties(). unique ph id found column id. index refers index data frame row. right hand side (rhs) label assignment (<- new_labels), two ways optionally specify subset phs rename. cases, length rhs vector (new labels) must match length id index: use id argument specify ph ids rename: layout_rename_ph_labels(..., id = 2:3) <- new_labels use index squared brackets: layout_rename_ph_labels(...)[1:2] <- new_labels

title: Change ph labels in a layout — layout_rename_ph_labels
code: x <- read_pptx()  # INFO -------------  # Returns layout's ph_labels by default in same order as layout_properties() layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison") #> [1] "Title 1"                    "Text Placeholder 2"         #> [3] "Text Placeholder 4"         "Content Placeholder 3"      #> [5] "Content Placeholder 5"      "Date Placeholder 6"         #> [7] "Footer Placeholder 7"       "Slide Number Placeholder 8" layout_properties(x, "Comparison")$ph_label #> [1] "Title 1"                    "Text Placeholder 2"         #> [3] "Text Placeholder 4"         "Content Placeholder 3"      #> [5] "Content Placeholder 5"      "Date Placeholder 6"         #> [7] "Footer Placeholder 7"       "Slide Number Placeholder 8"   # BASICS ----------- # # HINT: run `plot_layout_properties(x, "Comparison")` to see how labels change  # rename using key-value pairs: 'old label' = 'new label' or 'id' = 'new label' layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison", "Title 1" = "LABEL MATCHED") # label matching layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison", "3" = "ID MATCHED") # id matching layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison", "Date Placeholder 6" = "DATE", "8" = "FOOTER") # label, id  # rename using a named list and the .dots arg renames <- list("Content Placeholder 3" = "CONTENT_1", "6" = "CONTENT_2") layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison", .dots = renames)  # rename via rhs assignment and optional index (not id!) layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison") <- LETTERS[1:8] layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison")[1:3] <- paste("CHANGED", 1:3)  # rename via rhs assignment and ph id (not index) layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison", id = c(2, 4)) <- paste("ID =", c(2, 4))   # MORE ------------  # make all labels lower case labels <- layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison") layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison") <- tolower(labels)  # rename all labels to type [type_idx] lp <- layout_properties(x, "Comparison") layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "Comparison") <- paste0(lp$type, " [", lp$type_idx, "]")  # rename duplicated placeholders (see also `layout_dedupe_ph_labels()`) file <- system.file("doc_examples", "ph_dupes.pptx", package = "officer") x <- read_pptx(file) lp <- layout_properties(x, "2-dupes") idx <- which(lp$ph_label == "Content 7") # exists twice layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "2-dupes")[idx] <- paste("DUPLICATE", seq_along(idx))  # warning: in case of duped labels only the first occurrence is renamed x <- read_pptx(file) layout_rename_ph_labels(x, "2-dupes", "Content 7" = "new label") #> Warning: When renaming a label with duplicates, only the first occurrence is renamed. #> ✖ Renaming 1 ph label with duplicates: "Content 7"

title: Extract media from a document object — media_extract
code: example_pptx <- system.file(package = "officer",   "doc_examples/example.pptx") doc <- read_pptx(example_pptx) content <- pptx_summary(doc) image_row <- content[content$content_type %in% "image", ] media_file <- image_row$media_file png_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") media_extract(doc, path = media_file, target = png_file) #> [1] TRUE

what: Manipulate Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents with 'officer' — officer
title: Manipulate Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents with 'officer' — officer
text: officer package facilitates access manipulation 'Microsoft Word' 'Microsoft PowerPoint' documents R. also supports writing 'RTF' documents. Examples usage : Create Word documents tables, titles, TOC graphics Importation Word PowerPoint files data objects Write updated content back PowerPoint presentation Clinical reporting automation Production reports shiny application start officer, read read_docx(), read_pptx() rtf_doc(). package also providing several objects can printed 'R Markdown' documents advanced Word PowerPoint reporting run_autonum() block_caption().

title: Manipulate Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Documents with 'officer' — officer

title: Hyperlink a placeholder — ph_hyperlink
code: fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") loc_manual <- ph_location(bg = "red", newlabel = "mytitle") doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, "Title and Content") doc <- ph_with(x = doc, "Un titre 1", location = loc_manual) slide_summary(doc) # read column ph_label here #>   type                                   id ph_label offx offy cx cy rotation #> 1 body d3d20e2c-586d-4ecb-8ba9-8d6216be4520  mytitle    1    1  4  3       NA #>   fld_id fld_type       text #> 1   <NA>     <NA> Un titre 1 doc <- ph_hyperlink(   x = doc, ph_label = "mytitle",   href = "https://cran.r-project.org" )  print(doc, target = fileout)

code: # ph_location_label demo ----  doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, layout = "Title and Content")  # all ph_label can be read here layout_properties(doc, layout = "Title and Content") #>    master_name              name   type type_idx id                   ph_label #> 1 Office Theme Title and Content  title        1  2                    Title 1 #> 2 Office Theme Title and Content   body        1  3      Content Placeholder 2 #> 3 Office Theme Title and Content     dt        1  4         Date Placeholder 3 #> 4 Office Theme Title and Content    ftr        1  5       Footer Placeholder 4 #> 5 Office Theme Title and Content sldNum        1  6 Slide Number Placeholder 5 #>                                            ph     offx      offy       cx #> 1                        <p:ph type="title"/> 0.500000 0.3003478 9.000000 #> 2                             <p:ph idx="1"/> 0.500000 1.7500000 9.000000 #> 3        <p:ph type="dt" sz="half" idx="10"/> 0.500000 6.9513889 2.333333 #> 4    <p:ph type="ftr" sz="quarter" idx="11"/> 3.416667 6.9513889 3.166667 #> 5 <p:ph type="sldNum" sz="quarter" idx="12"/> 7.166667 6.9513889 2.333333 #>          cy rotation                                 fld_id          fld_type #> 1 1.2500000       NA                                   <NA>              <NA> #> 2 4.9496533       NA                                   <NA>              <NA> #> 3 0.3993056       NA {E6744CE3-0875-4B69-89C0-6F72D8139561} datetimeFigureOut #> 4 0.3993056       NA                                   <NA>              <NA> #> 5 0.3993056       NA {8DADB20D-508E-4C6D-A9E4-257D5607B0F6}          slidenum  doc <- ph_with(doc, head(iris),   location = ph_location_label(ph_label = "Content Placeholder 2") ) doc <- ph_with(doc, format(Sys.Date()),   location = ph_location_label(ph_label = "Date Placeholder 3") ) doc <- ph_with(doc, "This is a title",   location = ph_location_label(ph_label = "Title 1") )  print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".pptx"))

title: Location of a placeholder based on a type — ph_location_type
text: type placeholder type look slide layout, one 'body', 'title', 'ctrTitle', 'subTitle', 'dt', 'ftr', 'sldNum'. type_idx Type index placeholder. one placeholder type (e.g., body), type index can supplied uniquely identify ph. index running number starting 1. assigned placeholder position  (top -> bottom, left -> right). See plot_layout_properties() details. idx argument used, position_right position_top ignored. position_right parameter used selection parameters provide unique position (example layout 'Two Content' contains two element type 'body'). TRUE, element right side selected, otherwise element left side selected. position_top position_right applied top versus bottom. newlabel label associate placeholder. id (DEPRECATED, use type_idx instead) Index placeholder. two body placeholder, can two different index: 1 2 first second body placeholders defined layout. argument used, position_right position_top ignored. ... unused arguments

title: Location of a placeholder based on a type — ph_location_type
code: # ph_location_type demo ----  loc_title <- ph_location_type(type = "title") loc_footer <- ph_location_type(type = "ftr") loc_dt <- ph_location_type(type = "dt") loc_slidenum <- ph_location_type(type = "sldNum") loc_body <- ph_location_type(type = "body")   doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, "Title and Content") doc <- ph_with(x = doc, "Un titre", location = loc_title) doc <- ph_with(x = doc, "pied de page", location = loc_footer) doc <- ph_with(x = doc, format(Sys.Date()), location = loc_dt) doc <- ph_with(x = doc, "slide 1", location = loc_slidenum) doc <- ph_with(x = doc, letters[1:10], location = loc_body)  loc_subtitle <- ph_location_type(type = "subTitle") loc_ctrtitle <- ph_location_type(type = "ctrTitle") doc <- add_slide(doc, layout = "Title Slide") doc <- ph_with(x = doc, "Un sous titre", location = loc_subtitle) doc <- ph_with(x = doc, "Un titre", location = loc_ctrtitle)  fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") print(doc, target = fileout)

title: Remove a shape — ph_remove
code: fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") dummy_fun <- function(doc) {   doc <- add_slide(doc,     layout = "Two Content",     master = "Office Theme"   )   doc <- ph_with(     x = doc, value = "Un titre",     location = ph_location_type(type = "title")   )   doc <- ph_with(     x = doc, value = "Un corps 1",     location = ph_location_type(type = "body", id = 1)   )   doc <- ph_with(     x = doc, value = "Un corps 2",     location = ph_location_type(type = "body", id = 2)   )   doc } doc <- read_pptx() for (i in 1:3) {   doc <- dummy_fun(doc) } #> Warning: ! The `id` argument in `ph_location_type()` is deprecated as of officer 0.6.7. #> ℹ Please use the `type_idx` argument instead. #> ✖ Caution: new index logic in `type_idx` (see docs). #> Warning: ! The `id` argument in `ph_location_type()` is deprecated as of officer 0.6.7. #> ℹ Please use the `type_idx` argument instead. #> ✖ Caution: new index logic in `type_idx` (see docs). #> Warning: ! The `id` argument in `ph_location_type()` is deprecated as of officer 0.6.7. #> ℹ Please use the `type_idx` argument instead. #> ✖ Caution: new index logic in `type_idx` (see docs). #> Warning: ! The `id` argument in `ph_location_type()` is deprecated as of officer 0.6.7. #> ℹ Please use the `type_idx` argument instead. #> ✖ Caution: new index logic in `type_idx` (see docs). #> Warning: ! The `id` argument in `ph_location_type()` is deprecated as of officer 0.6.7. #> ℹ Please use the `type_idx` argument instead. #> ✖ Caution: new index logic in `type_idx` (see docs). #> Warning: ! The `id` argument in `ph_location_type()` is deprecated as of officer 0.6.7. #> ℹ Please use the `type_idx` argument instead. #> ✖ Caution: new index logic in `type_idx` (see docs).  doc <- on_slide(doc, index = 1) doc <- ph_remove(x = doc, type = "title")  doc <- on_slide(doc, index = 2) doc <- ph_remove(x = doc, type = "body", id = 2)  doc <- on_slide(doc, index = 3) doc <- ph_remove(x = doc, type = "body", id = 1)  print(doc, target = fileout)

Supported objects vectors, data.frame, graphics, block formatted paragraphs, unordered list formatted paragraphs, pretty tables package flextable, editable graphics package rvg, 'Microsoft' charts package mschart. location placeholder location object location short form. used specify location new shape. location can defined call one ph_location_* functions (see section "see also"). ph_with(), several location short forms can used, listed section "Short forms". ... arguments passed methods. adding ggplot object plot_instr, arguments used png function. format_fun format function non character vectors level_list list levels hierarchy structure integer values. used object formated unordered list. 1 2, item 1 level 1, item 2 level 2. header display header TRUE tcf conditional formatting settings defined table_conditional_formatting() alignment alignment columns, 'l' left, 'r' right 'c' center. Default NULL. res resolution png image ppi alt_text Alt-text screen-readers. Defaults "". "" NULL alt text added ggplot2::labs(alt = ...) used . scale Multiplicative scaling factor, ggsave use_loc_size set FALSE, external_img width height used.

Use package 'flextable' instead advanced formattings. ph_with.gg(): add ggplot object new shape current slide. Use package 'rvg' advanced graphical features. ph_with.plot_instr(): add R plot new shape current slide. Use package 'rvg' advanced graphical features. ph_with.external_img(): add external_img() new shape current slide. value external_img object, image copied PowerPoint presentation. width height specified call external_img() ignored, values location, unless use_loc_size set FALSE. ph_with.fpar(): add fpar() new shape current slide single paragraph block_list(). ph_with.empty_content(): add empty_content() new shape current slide. ph_with.xml_document(): add xml_document object new shape current slide. function used add custom openxml code.

title: Add objects on the current slide — ph_with
text: location argument ph_with() either expects location object returned ph_location_* functions corresponding location short form (string numeric):

title: Add objects on the current slide — ph_with
code: # this name will be used to print the file # change it to "youfile.pptx" to write the pptx # file in your working directory. fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx")  doc_1 <- read_pptx() sz <- slide_size(doc_1) # add text and a table ---- doc_1 <- add_slide(doc_1, layout = "Two Content", master = "Office Theme") doc_1 <- ph_with(   x = doc_1, value = c("Table cars"),   location = ph_location_type(type = "title") ) doc_1 <- ph_with(   x = doc_1, value = names(cars),   location = ph_location_left() ) doc_1 <- ph_with(   x = doc_1, value = cars,   location = ph_location_right() )  # add a base plot ---- anyplot <- plot_instr(code = {   col <- c(     "#440154FF", "#443A83FF", "#31688EFF",     "#21908CFF", "#35B779FF", "#8FD744FF", "#FDE725FF"   )   barplot(1:7, col = col, yaxt = "n") })  doc_1 <- add_slide(doc_1, "Title and Content") doc_1 <- ph_with(doc_1, anyplot,   location = ph_location_fullsize(),   bg = "#006699" )  # add a ggplot2 plot ---- if (require("ggplot2")) {   doc_1 <- add_slide(doc_1, "Title and Content")   gg_plot <- ggplot(data = iris) +     geom_point(       mapping = aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Length),       size = 3     ) +     theme_minimal()   doc_1 <- ph_with(     x = doc_1, value = gg_plot,     location = ph_location_type(type = "body"),     bg = "transparent"   )   doc_1 <- ph_with(     x = doc_1, value = "graphic title",     location = ph_location_type(type = "title")   ) }  # add a external images ---- doc_1 <- add_slide(doc_1,   layout = "Title and Content",   master = "Office Theme" ) doc_1 <- ph_with(   x = doc_1, value = empty_content(),   location = ph_location(     left = 0, top = 0,     width = sz$width, height = sz$height, bg = "black"   ) )  svg_file <- file.path(R.home(component = "doc"), "html/Rlogo.svg") if (require("rsvg")) {   doc_1 <- ph_with(     x = doc_1, value = "External images",     location = ph_location_type(type = "title")   )   doc_1 <- ph_with(     x = doc_1, external_img(svg_file, 100 / 72, 76 / 72),     location = ph_location_right(), use_loc_size = FALSE   )   doc_1 <- ph_with(     x = doc_1, external_img(svg_file),     location = ph_location_left(),     use_loc_size = TRUE   ) } #> Loading required package: rsvg #> Linking to librsvg 2.52.5  # add a block_list ---- dummy_text <- readLines(system.file(   package = "officer",   "doc_examples/text.txt" )) fp_1 <- fp_text(bold = TRUE, color = "pink", font.size = 0) fp_2 <- fp_text(bold = TRUE, font.size = 0) fp_3 <- fp_text(italic = TRUE, color = "red", font.size = 0) bl <- block_list(   fpar(ftext("hello world", fp_1)),   fpar(     ftext("hello", fp_2),     ftext("hello", fp_3)   ),   dummy_text ) doc_1 <- add_slide(doc_1, "Title and Content") doc_1 <- ph_with(   x = doc_1, value = bl,   location = ph_location_type(type = "body") )   # fpar ------ fpt <- fp_text(   bold = TRUE, font.family = "Bradley Hand",   font.size = 150, color = "#F5595B" ) hw <- fpar(   ftext("hello ", fpt),   hyperlink_ftext(     href = "https://cran.r-project.org/index.html",     text = "cran", prop = fpt   ) ) doc_1 <- add_slide(doc_1, "Title and Content") doc_1 <- ph_with(   x = doc_1, value = hw,   location = ph_location_type(type = "body") ) # unordered_list ---- ul <- unordered_list(   level_list = c(1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 1),   str_list = c("Level1", "Level2", "Level2", "Level3", "Level3", "Level1"),   style = fp_text(color = "red", font.size = 0) ) doc_1 <- add_slide(doc_1, "Title and Content") doc_1 <- ph_with(   x = doc_1, value = ul,   location = ph_location_type() )  print(doc_1, target = fileout)   # Example using short form locations ---- x <- read_pptx() x <- add_slide(x, "Title Slide") x <- ph_with(x, "A title", "Title 1")        # label x <- ph_with(x, "A subtitle", 3)             # id x <- ph_with(x, "A left text", "left")       # keyword x <- ph_with(x, "A date", "dt[1]")           # type + index x <- ph_with(x, "More content", c(5,.5,9,2)) # numeric vector file <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") print(x, file) # browseURL(file)  # opens file on some systems

what: Fill multiple placeholders using key value syntax — phs_with
title: Fill multiple placeholders using key value syntax — phs_with
text: sibling ph_with fills mutiple placeholders . Placeholder locations specfied using short form syntax. location corresponding object passed key value pairs (phs_with("short form location" = object)). hood, ph_with called pair. Note phs_with cover options ph_location_* family also less customization. covenience wrapper common use cases. implemented short forms listed section "Short forms".

title: Fill multiple placeholders using key value syntax — phs_with
code: phs_with(x, ..., .dots = NULL, .slide_idx = NULL)

title: Fill multiple placeholders using key value syntax — phs_with
text: x rpptx object. ... Key-value pairs form "short form location" = object. short form integer string blanks, must wrap quotes backticks. .dots List key-value pairs "short form location" = object. Alternative .... .slide_idx Numeric indexes slides process. NULL (default) processes current slide . Use keyword slides.

title: Fill multiple placeholders using key value syntax — phs_with
text: following short forms implemented can used parameter function call. corresponding function ph_location_* family (called hood) displayed right.

title: Fill multiple placeholders using key value syntax — phs_with
code: library(officer)  # use key-value format to fill phs x <- read_pptx() x <- add_slide(x, "Two Content") x <- phs_with(x,   `Title 1` = "A title", # ph label   dt = "Jan. 26, 2025", # ph type   `body[2]` = "Body 2", # ph type + type index   left = "Left side", # ph keyword   `6` = "Footer" # ph index )  # reuse ph content via the .dots arg x <- read_pptx() my_ph_list <- list(`6` = "Footer", dt = "Jan. 26, 2025") x <- add_slide(x, "Two Content") x <- phs_with(x, `Title 1` = "Title A", `body[2]` = "Body A", .dots = my_ph_list) x <- add_slide(x, "Two Content") x <- phs_with(x, `Title 1` = "Title B", `body[2]` = "Body B", .dots = my_ph_list)  # use the .slide_idx arg to select which slide(s) to process x <- read_pptx() x <- add_slide(x, "Two Content") x <- add_slide(x, "Two Content") x <- phs_with(x, `6` = "Footer", dt = "Jan. 26, 2025", .slide_idx = 1:2)  # run to see results if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ file <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") print(x, file) browseURL(file) # may not work on all systems } # }

what: Wrap plot instructions for png plotting in Powerpoint or Word — plot_instr
title: Wrap plot instructions for png plotting in Powerpoint or Word — plot_instr
text: simple wrapper capture plot instructions executed copied document. produces object class 'plot_instr' corresponding method ph_with() body_add_plot(). function enable usage R plot argument code. Wrap code curly bracket single expression.

title: Wrap plot instructions for png plotting in Powerpoint or Word — plot_instr
code: plot_instr(code)

title: Wrap plot instructions for png plotting in Powerpoint or Word — plot_instr
text: code plotting instructions

title: Wrap plot instructions for png plotting in Powerpoint or Word — plot_instr
code: # plot_instr demo ----  anyplot <- plot_instr(code = {   barplot(1:5, col = 2:6)   })  doc <- read_docx() doc <- body_add(doc, anyplot, width = 5, height = 4) print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))   doc <- read_pptx() doc <- add_slide(doc, "Title and Content") doc <- ph_with(   doc, anyplot,   location = ph_location_fullsize(),   bg = "#00000066", pointsize = 12) print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".pptx"))

title: Slide layout properties plot — plot_layout_properties
text: Plot slide layout properties corresponding placeholders. can useful help visualize placeholders locations identifiers. information plot stems layout_properties() output. See Details section info.

title: Slide layout properties plot — plot_layout_properties
code: plot_layout_properties(   x,   layout = NULL,   master = NULL,   labels = TRUE,   title = TRUE,   type = TRUE,   id = TRUE,   cex = c(labels = 0.5, type = 0.5, id = 0.5),   legend = FALSE )

title: Slide layout properties plot — plot_layout_properties
text: x rpptx object layout slide layout name numeric index (row index layout_summary(). NULL (default), plots current slide's layout default layout (set slides yet). master master layout name layout located. Can omitted layout unambiguous. labels TRUE (default), adds placeholder labels (centered red). title TRUE (default), adds title layout name top. type TRUE (default), adds placeholder type index (square brackets) upper left corner (blue). id TRUE (default), adds placeholder's unique id (see column id layout_properties()) upper right corner (green). cex List vector specify font size labels, type, id. Default c(labels = .5, type = .5, id = .5). See graphics::text() details cex works. Matching position partial name matching supported. single numeric value apply three parameters. legend Add legend plot (default FALSE).

title: Slide layout properties plot — plot_layout_properties
text: plot contains relevant information reference placeholder via ph_location_* function family: label: ph label (red, center) used ph_location_label(). NB: label can assigned user PowerPoint. type[idx]: ph type + type index brackets (blue, upper left) used ph_location_type(). NB: index consecutive sorted ph position (top -> bottom, left -> right). id: ph id (green, upper right) used ph_location_id() (forthcoming). NB: id set PowerPoint automatically lack meaningful order.

title: Slide layout properties plot — plot_layout_properties
code: x <- read_pptx()  # select layout explicitly plot_layout_properties(x = x, layout = "Title Slide", master = "Office Theme")  plot_layout_properties(x = x, layout = "Title Slide") # no master needed if layout name unique plot_layout_properties(x = x, layout = 1) # use layout index instead of name  # plot current slide's layout (default if no layout is passed) x <- read_pptx() x <- add_slide(x, "Title Slide") plot_layout_properties(x) #> ℹ Showing current slide's layout: "Title Slide"  # change appearance: what to show, font size, legend etc. plot_layout_properties(x, layout = "Two Content", title = FALSE, type = FALSE, id = FALSE)  plot_layout_properties(x, layout = 4, cex = c(labels = .8, id = .7, type = .7))  plot_layout_properties(x, 1, legend = TRUE)

title: Section properties — prop_section
text: section grouping blocks (ie. paragraphs tables) set properties define pages text appear. Section properties object stores information page composition, page size, page orientation, borders margins.

title: Section properties — prop_section
code: prop_section(   page_size = NULL,   page_margins = NULL,   type = "continuous",   section_columns = NULL,   header_default = NULL,   header_even = NULL,   header_first = NULL,   footer_default = NULL,   footer_even = NULL,   footer_first = NULL )

title: Section properties — prop_section
text: page_size page dimensions, object generated function page_size. page_margins page margins, object generated function page_mar. type Section type. defines contents section placed relative previous section. Available types "continuous" (begins section next paragraph), "evenPage" (begins next even-numbered page), "nextColumn" (begins next column page), "nextPage" (begins following page), "oddPage" (begins next odd-numbered page). section_columns section columns, object generated function section_columns. Use NULL (default value) content. header_default content block_list() default page header. Use NULL (default value) content. header_even content block_list() even page header. Use NULL (default value) content. header_first content block_list() first page header. Use NULL (default value) content. footer_default content block_list() default page footer. Use NULL (default value) content. footer_even content block_list() even page footer. Use NULL (default value) content. footer_first content block_list() default page footer. Use NULL (default value) content.

title: Section properties — prop_section
code: library(officer)  landscape_one_column <- block_section(   prop_section(     page_size = page_size(orient = "landscape"), type = "continuous"   ) ) landscape_two_columns <- block_section(   prop_section(     page_size = page_size(orient = "landscape"), type = "continuous",     section_columns = section_columns(widths = c(4.75, 4.75))   ) )  doc_1 <- read_docx() # there starts section with landscape_one_column doc_1 <- body_add_table(doc_1, value = mtcars[1:10, ], style = "table_template") doc_1 <- body_end_block_section(doc_1, value = landscape_one_column) # there stops section with landscape_one_column   # there starts section with landscape_two_columns doc_1 <- body_add_par(doc_1, value = paste(rep(letters, 50), collapse = " ")) doc_1 <- body_end_block_section(doc_1, value = landscape_two_columns) # there stops section with landscape_two_columns  doc_1 <- body_add_table(doc_1, value = mtcars[1:25, ], style = "table_template")  print(doc_1, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))   # an example with headers and footers ----- txt_lorem <- rep(   "Purus lectus eros metus turpis mattis platea praesent sed. ",   50 ) txt_lorem <- paste0(txt_lorem, collapse = "")  header_first <- block_list(fpar(ftext("text for first page header"))) header_even <- block_list(fpar(ftext("text for even page header"))) header_default <- block_list(fpar(ftext("text for default page header"))) footer_first <- block_list(fpar(ftext("text for first page footer"))) footer_even <- block_list(fpar(ftext("text for even page footer"))) footer_default <- block_list(fpar(ftext("text for default page footer")))  ps <- prop_section(   header_default = header_default, footer_default = footer_default,   header_first = header_first, footer_first = footer_first,   header_even = header_even, footer_even = footer_even ) x <- read_docx() for (i in 1:20) {   x <- body_add_par(x, value = txt_lorem) } x <- body_set_default_section(   x,   value = ps ) print(x, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

code: library(officer)  def_text <- fp_text_lite(color = "#006699", bold = TRUE) center_par <- fp_par(text.align = "center", padding = 3)  doc <- rtf_doc(   normal_par = fp_par(line_spacing = 1.4, padding = 3) )  doc <- rtf_add(   x = doc,   value = fpar(     ftext("how are you?", prop = def_text),     fp_p = fp_par(text.align = "center")   ) )  a_paragraph <- fpar(   ftext("Here is a date: ", prop = def_text),   run_word_field(field = "Date \\@ \"MMMM d yyyy\""),   fp_p = center_par ) doc <- rtf_add(   x = doc,   value = block_list(     a_paragraph,     a_paragraph,     a_paragraph   ) )  if (require("ggplot2")) {   gg <- gg_plot <- ggplot(data = iris) +     geom_point(mapping = aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Length))   doc <- rtf_add(doc, gg,     width = 3, height = 4,     ppr = center_par   ) } anyplot <- plot_instr(code = {   barplot(1:5, col = 2:6) }) doc <- rtf_add(doc, anyplot,   width = 5, height = 4,   ppr = center_par )  print(doc, target = tempfile(fileext = ".rtf")) #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpabDida/file176a75575979.rtf"

title: Auto number — run_autonum
text: seq_id sequence identifier pre_label, post_label text add number bkm bookmark id associate autonumber run. NULL, bookmark added. Value can made alpha numeric characters, ':', -' '_'. bkm_all TRUE, bookmark set whole string, FALSE, bookmark set number . Default FALSE. effect reference bookmark used, text can like "Table 1" "1" (pre_label included referenced text). prop formatting text properties returned fp_text. start_at NULL, must positive integer, specifies new number use, number auto numbering restart. tnd title number depth, positive integer (applies positive) specify depth (heading level depth) use prefixing caption number last reference number. example, setting tnd=2 generate numbered captions like '4.3-2' (figure 2 chapter 4.3). tns separator use title number table number. Default "-".

title: Set notes for current slide — set_notes
code: # this name will be used to print the file # change it to "youfile.pptx" to write the pptx # file in your working directory. fileout <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx") fpt_blue_bold <- fp_text_lite(color = "#006699", bold = TRUE) doc <- read_pptx() # add a slide with some text ---- doc <- add_slide(doc, layout = "Title and Content") doc <- ph_with(x = doc, value = "Slide Title 1",    location = ph_location_type(type = "title") ) # set speaker notes for the slide ---- doc <- set_notes(doc, value = "This text will only be visible for the speaker.",    location = notes_location_type("body"))  # add a slide with some text ---- doc <- add_slide(doc, layout = "Title and Content") doc <- ph_with(x = doc, value = "Slide Title 2",    location = ph_location_type(type = "title") ) bl <- block_list(   fpar(ftext("hello world", fpt_blue_bold)),   fpar(ftext("Turlututu chapeau pointu", fpt_blue_bold)) ) doc <- set_notes(doc, value = bl,    location = notes_location_type("body"))  print(doc, target = fileout)

code: path <- system.file("doc_examples/example.pptx", package = "officer") x <- read_pptx(path)  slide_visible(x) # get slide visibilities #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE  x <- slide_visible(x, hide = 1:2) # hide slides 1 and 2 x <- slide_visible(x, show = 1:2) # make slides 1 and 2 visible x <- slide_visible(x, show = 1:2, hide = 3)  slide_visible(x) <- FALSE # hide all slides slide_visible(x) <- c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE) # set each slide separately slide_visible(x) <- c(TRUE, FALSE) # warns that rhs values are recycled #> Warning: Value is not length 1 or same length as number of slides (3). Recycling values.  slide_visible(x)[2] <- TRUE # set 2nd slide to visible slide_visible(x)[c(1, 3)] <- FALSE # 1st and 3rd slide slide_visible(x)[c(1, 3)] <- c(FALSE, FALSE) # identical

title: Line properties — sp_line
text: color line color - single character value specifying valid color (e.g. "#000000" "black"). lwd line width (point) - 0 positive integer value. lty single character value specifying line type. Expected value one following : default 'solid' 'dot' 'dash' 'lgDash' 'dashDot' 'lgDashDot' 'lgDashDotDot' 'sysDash' 'sysDot' 'sysDashDot' 'sysDashDotDot'. linecmpd single character value specifying compound line type. Expected value one following : default 'sng' 'dbl' 'tri' 'thinThick' 'thickThin' lineend single character value specifying line end style Expected value one following : default 'rnd' 'sq' 'flat' linejoin single character value specifying line join style Expected value one following : default 'round' 'bevel' 'miter' headend sp_lineend object specifying line head end style tailend sp_lineend object specifying line tail end style x, object sp_line object ... arguments - used

title: Table conditional formatting — table_conditional_formatting

title: Table conditional formatting — table_conditional_formatting
text: first_row, last_row apply remove formatting first last row table. first_column, last_column apply remove formatting first last column table. no_hband, no_vband display odd even rows columns alternating shading ease reading.

title: Table conditional formatting — table_conditional_formatting

title: Algorithm for table layout — table_layout

title: Algorithm for table layout — table_layout

title: Paragraph styles for columns — table_stylenames
text: stylenames named character vector, names column names, values paragraph styles associated column. column specified, default value 'Normal' used. Another form named list, list names styles contents column names formatted corresponding style.

title: Paragraph styles for columns — table_stylenames
code: library(officer)  stylenames <- c(   vs = "centered", am = "centered",   gear = "centered", carb = "centered" )  doc_1 <- read_docx() doc_1 <- body_add_table(doc_1,   value = mtcars, style = "table_template",   stylenames = table_stylenames(stylenames = stylenames) )  print(doc_1, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))   stylenames <- list(   "centered" = c("vs", "am", "gear", "carb") )  doc_2 <- read_docx() doc_2 <- body_add_table(doc_2,   value = mtcars, style = "table_template",   stylenames = table_stylenames(stylenames = stylenames) )  print(doc_2, target = tempfile(fileext = ".docx"))

title: officer 0.6.9 (development version)
text: New functions body_append_start_context(), write_elements_to_context() body_append_stop_context() append elements end Word document faster way. useful document large user wants append elements end document. New function block_gg() add ggplot object Word document. handy user wants add ggplot object Word document new function write_elements_to_context(). New function fp_par_lite() create paragraph formatting object properties needed. useful user wants create paragraph object properties needed properties. can also used create paragraph formatting object reuse style modifications. Function print.rdocx() gains new arguments copy_header_refs copy_footer_refs copy header footer references default section sections. useful user wants add sections also propagate header footer references.

title: officer 0.6.9 (development version)
text: Refactored body_add.block_list() speed process adding block list Word document, optimization process made minimizing call docx_current_block_xml(). print.rdocx() execution time improvements.

title: officer 0.6.9 (development version)
text: add_slide(): now suffices specify unique layout. master inferred automatically. Also, default values layout ("Title Content") master ("Office Theme") arg removed. applied default pptx template used read_pptx(). avoid breaking changes old code, add_slide() now throws deprecation warning, layout specified (either via layout arg setting default layout). uses layout arg’s former default value ("Title Content"). makes sure, behavior add_slide() change avoids backward compatibility issues (#635) layout_default() sets default layout add_slide() (#635). print.rpptx now uses pluralization marks default layout (set layout_default()) asterisk (#635) Fixed docx_summary() text run associated text style paragraph text styles registered Word document style table (thanks Kaspar Meili). plot_layout_properties() now takes cex vector list matches position, name partial name. Zero values now hide text. single value now applies three cex parameters (label, type, id) (#645) plot_layout_properties() now shows default layout, one set slides yet (#645) Default page size now set exact A4 format Word documents: 11906 / 1440 16838 / 1440 instead 21 / 2.54 29.7 / 2.54.

title: officer 0.6.9 (development version)
text: Deprecate function docx_reference_img() longer useful..

title: officer 0.6.8
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-23

title: officer 0.6.8
text: Simplified input format location arg ph_with_* functions (#623). Instead location object created ph_location_* function family, ph_with_* functions now resolves certain short form input corresponding location objects. example, instead using ph_location_label("<label>") can now simply pass "<label>" location arg. functionn convert string corresponding location object automatically. examples "body [1]" ph_location_type(type = "body", type_idx = 1), integer 1 ph_location_id(id = 1) Add slide_visible() get set visibility slides (#622). debug selector ph_remove() (see #625) working rvg outputs. phs_with: filling multiple placeholders one slides using key-value pair syntax (#639). add_slide: new args ... .dots, passed phs_with create slide fill placeholders one step (#639). add support pdf office extensions (#613).

title: officer 0.6.8
text: remove old visual tests

title: officer 0.6.7
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-09

title: officer 0.6.7
text: store paddings numeric values integer values. remove_fields docx_summary() now also removes “w:fldData” nodes. complete manual body_add_docx() note file basename can contain ’ ’ trigger error contains ’ ’. plot_layout_properties() gains ‘title’ parameter, add layout name plot title. Defaults FALSE, alter old behavior. Also, slide width height now correctly displayed plot. , box drawn around plot area. However, plot area var device size, slide size. class dir_collection: Files now added container order trailing numeric index (#596). example, slideLayout2.xml now preceed slideLayout10.xml. , alphabetical sorting used, slideLayout10.xml comes slideLayout2.xml. layout_properties() now returns placeholders case multiple master (#597). Also, internal xfrmize() now sorts resulting data placeholder position. yields intuitive order, placeholders sorted top bottom left right. ph_location_type() now throws error id type range (#602) informative error message type present layout (#601). plot_layout_properties() assignment order fixed labels= FALSE (#604) layout_properties() gains type_idx column index phs type layout. Indexing performed based ph position, following top--bottom, left--right order (#606). plot_layout_properties() plots information default now: layout name, ph label, ph id, ph type + index default (#606). ph_location_type(): new type_idx arg replaces deprecated id arg (#606). Add ph_location_id() new member ph_location_* family. references placeholder via unique id (#606). plot_layout_properties(): Now accepts layout index (see layout_summary()) alternative layout name. Gains argument legend add legend plot. Also prints current slide’s layout default now, layout name provided explicitly (#595).

title: officer 0.6.7
text: layout_rename_ph_labels() rename ph labels (#610). add layout_dedupe_ph_labels() handle duplicate placeholder labels (#589). default, detect duplicate labels, apply changes. action = "rename", auto-renames duplicate labels action = "delete" deletes duplicates, keeping first occurrence. new convenience functions body_replace_gg_at_bkm() body_replace_plot_at_bkm() replace text content enclosed bookmark ggplot base plot. add unit (, cm, mm) argument function page_size().

title: officer 0.6.6
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-05

title: officer 0.6.6
text: Fix. docx_summary preserves non-breaking hyphens. Non-breaking hyphens replaced hyphen-minus (Unicode character 002D). Closes #573. docx_summary() gains parameter ‘detailed’ allows get detailed summary including formatting properties runs paragraph. Formatting properties stored list column run, element dataframe rows corresponding single run columns containing information formatting properties. Fix. Add alt text ggplot’s added pptx ph_with.gg. Closes #556. embedded image PPT can now associated hyperlink add check block_pour_docx() avoid working file paths containing ‘&’.

title: officer 0.6.6
text: add coverage rtf, contributions Davide Garolini roche. cursor_reach() gains new argument fixed enable exact matching. defaults FALSE backward compatibility. remove_slide() gains new argument rm_images enable images deletion ppt/media. new function body_comment() adds comment existing paragraph cursor position. docx_summary() gains parameter ‘remove_field’ prevent field codes appearing returned data.frame.
